primary_changes: Introduced new constants and utility functions for disagreement severity

patterns_discovered: Centralized mapping of disagreement types to severity levels
Utility functions for comparing and filtering disagreements
gotchas_discovered: Need for consistent severity classification across comparison functions
Importance of defining clear rules for disagreement severity
Potential complexity in managing multiple severity-related constants
recommendations: Maintain the centralized DISAGREEMENT_SEVERITY_MAP for future disagreement types
Consider adding more granular severity levels if complexity increases
Document the reasoning behind severity classifications clearly
Create comprehensive tests to validate severity classification logic
